summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, regarding the urgent need to reconstruct inmate Jeffrey Epstein's 292 record (likely a log of activities or movements) for the week prior to his death on August 10, 2019. It indicates internal efforts to gather data following his death in the SHU at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose records are being urgently reconstructed following his death in custody.

persons.name: Mg Black
persons.context: The sender of the email on August 11, 2019, who attached a 292 history report for Epstein and noted an inability to access the J3P1 system.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his Special Housing Unit (SHU) cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Start of 292 Record Reconstruction Period
events.description: The beginning of the week for which Epstein's 292 record (likely detailing inmate activities, movements, or checks) needed to be reconstructed.

events.title: End of 292 Record Reconstruction Period
events.description: The end of the week (Friday) prior to Epstein's death for which his 292 record needed to be reconstructed.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his Special Housing Unit (SHU) cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on the morning of Saturday, August 10, 2019.
An urgent internal task was initiated to reconstruct Epstein's '292 record' for the week of August 5-9, 2019, immediately following his death.
The email indicates a system access issue (J3P1) that prevented researching Epstein's full history records, prompting a manual reconstruction effort.
The correspondence highlights the immediate administrative and investigative response within the Bureau of Prisons following Epstein's death in custody.
